intro: Rhabdotheca longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its flowers, which are often pink or purple, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Rhabdotheca longiloba is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as a decorative succulent.
